node.title: New space at Sydney Opera House provides chance for people to get creative
node.description: The Sydney Opera House unveils its latest performance space aimed at encouraging the audience to explore their creativity.

node.title: A constant support: Billy Evans, Elizabeth Holmes’s partner.

node.title: Who are the Arbery murder defendants?
node.description: The three men accused of murdering Ahmaud Arbery are Gregory McMichael, 65; his 35-year-old son, Travis McMichael; and their neighbor, William Bryan, 52.

node.title: Slain Journalist Jamal Khashoggi's Fiancée Urges Justin Bieber to Cancel Saudi Arabia Show
node.description: Khashoggi was killed in 2018 when he traveled to Istanbul, Turkey, for an appointment at the Saudi consulate to obtain documents required to get married.

node.title: Kansas GOP Proposes Those Fired Over COVID Vaccine Mandate Be Eligible for Unemployment
node.description: Conservative Kansas legislators added a proposal to a religious exemption bill that would make vaccine-refusing workers eligible for unemployment benefits.

node.title: Woman stole $940k to play online game with no chance of 'real money' win
node.description: A Tasmanian woman has pleaded guilty to stealing $940,000 from her employer to fund her addiction to an online gambling game that does not pay out real money.

node.title: Video reveals 'bastardisation' of recruit at army base
node.description: Lawyers for a young former military recruit are taking the Australian Defence Force to court over his experience at an army barracks in Victoria.

node.title: Covid-19: Self-isolating cases need help to understand oximeters - experts
node.description: Health experts are concerned some people self-isolating with Covid-19 aren't getting enough information on how to use a small, potentially life-saving device.

node.title: Details of 'progressive' MIQ phase out in two weeks - Hipkins

node.title: Explained: What the traffic light system is and how it works
node.description: On 3 December, the country will move into the traffic light system. Here's what that will mean for how you go about your life.

node.title: Hundreds Line Up as Britain’s First Popeyes Opens
node.description: On Saturday, curious customers waited for hours at an East London shopping mall to get a taste of the Louisiana-based restaurant’s fried chicken.

node.title: Behind the Powell pick: a bet the economy has room to grow and inflation will fade.
node.description: President Biden views the incumbent Fed chair as sharing his values on price growth and the pursuit of a lower unemployment rate to help Black, Hispanic and other marginalized workers.

node.title: Police Offering $50K for Arrest After Pregnant Woman Killed Returning From Her Baby Shower
node.description: Police believe the woman, who was unloading gifts from her car, was "targeted" in the fatal shooting.

node.title: Darrell Brooks Should Not Have Been Released on Low Bail, Milwaukee DA Admits
node.description: The district attorney said the $1,000 cash bail set for Brooks on November 5 was "inappropriately low" given the charges he faced.

node.title: Phoenix Airport May Have Hungry Passengers During Busy Travel Week as Some Workers Strike
node.description: HMSHost concession workers at the Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport are going on an indefinite strike to protest stalled contract negotiations.

node.title: Metro Performance Glass makes $0.7m first half profit after Covid disruptions
node.description: Auckland based glass manufacturer Metro Performance Glass has clung to profitability as it struggles to combat the effects of Covid-lockdowns and supply chain problems.

node.title: Live Theater Is Back. But a New Broadway Play Will Stream, Too.
node.description: The digital experimentation born of the pandemic shutdown is continuing: the final 16 performances of Lynn Nottage’s “Clyde’s” will be streamed, for $59.

node.title: Outside the courthouse, supporters of Ahmaud Arbery’s family keep watch.
node.description: Supporters said that they were anxious but optimistic that the jury would find the three defendants guilty of murder.

node.title: Court Urged to Let Jan. 6 Panel See Trump White House Files
node.description: In appellate briefs, lawyers for the House and the Justice Department argued against the former president’s claim of executive privilege.

node.title: What Happens When It’s Too Late to Get an Abortion
node.description: Being denied an abortion can have serious consequences for a women’s health and livelihood. It can even be deadly.

node.title: Netflix buys a visual effects company in a move to support its global ambitions.
node.description: Terms of the deal were not disclosed, but the company, Scanline VFX, will continue to operate independently.

node.title: The men pursued Arbery because ‘he was a Black man running down the street,’ the prosecutor says in summation.
node.description: In her closing argument, Linda Dunikoski said that the defendants had no justification to pursue Ahmaud Arbery because they did not have any knowledge that he had committed a crime that day.

node.title: Kenya will impose widespread restrictions on the unvaccinated starting next month.
node.description: The move, which will begin Dec. 21, is part of an effort to push more people to get inoculated and curb the spread of the virus.

node.title: Russian Admiral Again Alleges NATO Submarine Responsible for 2000 Kursk Explosion
node.description: A retired Russian admiral alleged that the Kursk explosion was caused by a collision with a NATO submarine shadowing them, not a faulty torpedo.

node.title: African Americans, Millennials More Inclined to Donate to Social Justice Charities: Survey
node.description: The public trust in social justice charities also increased last year, according to charity rater Give.org

node.title: Fourth Stimulus Check Update: Build Back Better Would Send Monthly Payments Through 2022
node.description: Monthly Child Tax Credit payments are set to end in December, but legislators are hoping to continue them through 2022.

node.title: U.S. Among Countries to Have Seen Democracy Deteriorate Since Pandemic, Report Says
node.description: "Overall, the number of countries moving in an authoritarian direction in 2020 outnumbered those going in a democratic direction," the report said.

node.title: U.S. Median Home Price Climbs Again to $359K, Midwest Sees Highest Growth in Sales
node.description: "It looks like the housing market is remaining strong, resilient and one may even say, [had] something like a mini-surge...," the NAR's chief economist said.

node.title: This pastor thinks it's 'anti-Christian' to back the religious discrimination bill
node.description: The religious discrimination bill is expected to be introduced into Parliament this week. These queer pastors question the bill's necessity, and worry about its consequences.

node.title: 'You've got to risk it for the biscuit': Is equity crowdfunding worth the risk?
node.description: First-time investors are pouring millions of dollars into unlisted start-ups and small-to-medium-sized businesses through online crowdfunding campaigns. But is it really a smart way to invest?

node.title: This expert says too many social media platforms are 'wild west-y' when it becomes to protecting women's safety
node.description: Twenty-three-year-old Kate says she's impacted by the personal abuse she's faced online as well as a constant slew of degrading content. What are platforms doing about it?

node.title: What's with all the bird flu outbreaks lately, and should we be worried?
node.description: The COVID-19 pandemic may have crushed seasonal flu to historically low levels, but another type of flu — avian influenza or bird flu — has shown no signs of slowing.

node.title: With a nod to Adele, Spotify did something many big tech companies don't, they listened
node.description: For years, Spotify ignored pleas from artists and customers to change one aspect of their streaming service. But when Adele spoke, the streaming giant listened.

node.title: Costello says RBA 'irresponsible' on rates, but who is responsible for housing affordability?
node.description: Australia's skyrocketing property market has seen house prices increase 22 per cent in 12 months. As Alan Kohler writes, there's no easy answer to housing affordability.

node.title: Will Australia follow Europe into a fourth COVID wave?
node.description: Europe is facing a fourth wave of COVID. As we watch on, it is reasonable to ask whether Australia will be confronted with the same fate, writes Raina MacIntyre.

node.title: Robert Bly, Poet Who Gave Rise to a Men’s Movement, Dies at 94
node.description: His most famous, and most controversial, work was “Iron John: A Book About Men,” which made a case that American men had grown soft and feminized. It made him a cultural phenomenon.

node.title: Utah Dominates Oregon, Upending Pac-12’s Playoff Hopes

node.title: 80-Year-Old Bystander Injured During Riots Over COVID Vax Pass on Caribbean Island

node.description: "Injuries range from facial abrasions to broken bones to serious head injuries," said Dr. Amy Drendel of the Children's Hospital Wisconsin.

node.title: Unrest over vaccine mandates and economic inequality rocks Guadeloupe.

node.title: Critical Witness Testifies at Netanyahu Trial, Reviving a Drifting Case

node.title: Meridian Energy to sell its Australian business to Shell and ICG consortium

node.title: Elizabeth Warren says she will oppose Jerome Powell’s nomination, even as top Democrats express support.

node.title: Spotify Wrapped's Missing Data Means Your Music Taste Might Be Even Worse Than You Think

node.description: Of Austria's population of 8.9 million people, roughly 66 percent are vaccinated as a smaller but expressive minority of residents refuse to get the shots.
